Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that every federal employee will receive a $21,000 bonus check, which is not true.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or credible sources to back up the statement.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the COVID-19 relief package includes a bonus check for federal employees, which is not accurate.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no bonus check included in the relief package.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by misrepresenting the provision in the relief package that provides additional paid family leave to some federal employees as a bonus check for all employees.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no alternative explanation provided in the claim.
